alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Eastern Essex; Eastern Hanover; Eastern King and Queen; Richmond; Western Essex; Western King William; Western King and Queen; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 5:07PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern King and Queen, western Richmond, Caroline, northwestern Westmoreland, northwestern King William and Essex Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 507 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mangohick, or 10 miles east of Ashland, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, half inch hail, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Locations impacted include... Colonial Beach, Tappahannock, Warsaw, Bowling Green, Montross, Champlain, Saint Stephens Church, Milford, Hanover, Port Royal, Beulahville, Center Cross, Dawn, Loretto, Leedstown, Mangohick, Fort A.p. Hill, Millers Tavern, Ladysmith and Newtown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central, eastern, north central and east central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Caroline; Eastern Essex; Eastern Hanover; Eastern King and Queen; Richmond; Western Essex; Western King William; Western King and Queen; Westmoreland
